intro: Cienfuegosia affinis var. campestris, commonly known as the field cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in open, sunny habitats and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
